article: High expectations have always made sad. I would feel _ with myself whenever something wasn't perfect . Because of this, I _ to take part in activities at school . In the fourth grade I even became extremely depressed . Although I received medical treatment, the continual feeling of _ always made me so sad. Gradually I worked through some of my fears and found that I could do something well, I began to _ on doing well in the classroom and training for the sport wrestling . School and wrestling were two 35 _ in which I really gained a sense of self-worth ,so in both things I made a great effort to _ as well as I potentially could . However I _ the annual wrestling tournament . I found an empty room and _ for a long while .I knew I would have remained _ and never have been able to look outside myself if I had continued to stress the need for _ . The summer I decided to go on a backpacking trip with Young Life Student Ministries.I didn't go with any of my friends. On the trip I was with five other boys , complete _ but I was surprised by the kindness of them. During that 5-day trip I had the chance to _ with those boys the real struggles, mistakes and 43 _ in my life .I had never _ this kind of openness and support . Going back to school made me a little bit sad. _ the experience became a constant reminder of what an impressive life of freedom was. At the end of my senior year I chose to go to a college far from home where I could _ an equal education for much cheaper and continue to spend a lot of time with friends. My college experience has not been a(n) _ one. In college I have had to stop holding a lot of my previous ambition that once _ me, but in exchange I have experienced _ from the fears of self-centered life. I continue to struggle in the areas of being perfect, but it is amazing how much those struggles have _ throughout my time in college.
